speaker: Niles
text: You could live here.

speaker: Daphne
text: Are you asking me?

speaker: Niles
text: Would you like to?

speaker: Daphne
text: Would you like me to?

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah.

speaker: Daphne
text: Then I will. _CUT TO: Frasier and Martin at home:_

speaker: Frasier
text: I gave the greatest speech of my condo board career, which led to a vote, which led to a ruling that Cam Winston must now park that SUV monstrosity of his in the subbasement! [ ]

speaker: Martin
text: Think that's smart, taking on the guy who lives right above us? _CUT TO: Daphne coming out of her room:_

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, the move's off.

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Daphne
text: Just temporarily.  My parents are coming for a visit. [ ]

speaker: Niles
text: Just to clarify: you're going to stay here, but your parents are going to stay with me?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_hugs him_] Oh, I'm so glad you understand. _CUT TO: Niles and Daphne in his kitchen:_

speaker: Niles
text: If she thinks you're a virgin, how are you going to explain our plan to live together?

speaker: Daphne
text: I wonder how important it is that she ever finds out. _CUT TO: The last scene:_

speaker: Simon
text: Dad scarpered.

speaker: Daphne
text: He left?

speaker: Simon
text: Yeah.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: It's true.  Thank goodness I have my children to lean upon.

speaker: Simon
text: Oh, don't cry, Mum.  I really thought this junket to America would cheer you up.

speaker: Niles
text: It still can! [ ] Get out there and see the country.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, immerse yourself in the spectacle and the grandeur that are these United States, this... America. _As if on cue, a huge American flag falls from the above balcony, completely covering Frasier's windows with the stars and stripes._

speaker: Niles
text: How did you do that? [ ]

speaker: Frasier
text: Cam Winston! _FADE TO:  ACT ONE  Scene One - The Montana Daphne is seated on the couch.  Niles brings a tray of food._

speaker: Daphne
text: It was a good idea taking Mum out today, helped take her mind off Dad.

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, although I'm not sure the zoo was the best idea. The sight of those amorous wolverines seemed to set her back a bit.

speaker: Daphne
text: Amorous?  I thought they were trying to kill each other.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, either way, it seemed to remind her of something.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Mrs. Moon.  Would you care for a bite to eat?

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Oh, that would be lovely - if I thought I could keep anything down. [_sinks into a chair_] How could your father do this to me?  You sleep down the hall from someone for forty years, you think you know them!

speaker: Daphne
text: I know you're upset, Mum, but it's not like you and Dad had a perfect marriage.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: That's because there's no such thing!  You young modern people think marriage is some sort of promenade through paradise, when it's more like a march through Hell with a man strapped to your back and a litter of nasty babies swinging from your teats!

speaker: Daphne
text: Obviously, this is a very upsetting time for all of us. But, remember, tomorrow is another day!

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: You're right, dear.  And the sooner you get home to bed, the sooner it'll be here.

speaker: Daphne
text: But it's only 9:30!

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: And with every tick of the clock, your womanly resistance weakens, and before you know it he'll be on top of you like one of those bloody badgers at the zoo.

speaker: Niles
text: Actually, those were wolverines, and there's a chance they may have been fighting.

speaker: Daphne
text: It has been a long day.  Maybe it's best if I leave.

speaker: Niles
text: All right.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll see you tomorrow, Mum. [_kisses her Mum and goes to the door_] Goodnight, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Goodnight. _They start to kiss, but Mrs. Moon turns to look at them, so they just shake hands.  Daphne leaves.  FADE OUT  Scene Two - Apartment Frasier is standing by the fireplace, staring at the flag covering his windows.  Martin comes out in his robe._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, hey.  You still up?

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't sleep.  Every time I look outside, I feel like I'm living inside a giant clown's pocket.  I tell you, Cam Winston has not heard the last of this.  I am calling an emergency meeting of the condo board tomorrow morning!

speaker: Martin
text: You can't fight this, Frasier.  It'll just look like you're attacking the flag.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm not attacking the flag, Cam is using the flag to attack me!

speaker: Martin
text: You're right, but you're still going to lose.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but-but the building has bylaws about this sort of thing. If this was anything but the American flag, people would demand that it be taken down!

speaker: Martin
text: Face it, Fras, Cam's got you on this one.  Boy, I have to say, that guy is smart.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, really?  Well, if he's so smart and you're so smart, why don't you two live together?

speaker: Martin
text: At least he's got a view. _The door opens, and Simon stumbles in with a bottle in one hand and the other arm wrapped around a blowzy brunette.  They are both drunk._

speaker: Simon
text: Hello!

speaker: Frasier
text: What on earth do you think you're doing?!

speaker: Simon
text: Oh, sorry, I-I didn't know you was here.  Uh, Frasier, this is Loretta. [_she waves_] Loretta... well, you know who you are. [_they laugh_]

speaker: Loretta
text: [_sees the flag and gasps_] I love your curtains!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, miss, but we are not entertaining guests this evening.  You'll have to leave.

speaker: Loretta
text: [_to Simon_] Wait, you told me this was your place!  You're probably not even the Duke of England! [_exits_]

speaker: Simon
text: Oh, yeah?  Then why do I talk this way?

speaker: Simon
text: Well, you're just a big contraceptive, aren't you? [_takes a swig_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I've just about had it with you, Simon. [_goes to the hall and picks up Simon's duffel bag_] You have blown my speakers, clogged my Jacuzzi, and you have ingested half of my bath products! [_throws the duffel out the door_] You are no longer welcome in my home.

speaker: Simon
text: What exactly are you implying?

speaker: Frasier
text: GET OUT!

speaker: Martin
text: Fras, you can't throw him out, where's he gonna go?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, he'll land on his feet.  Probably end up shacking up with some two-bit floozy! _SMASH CUT TO:  Scene Three - Roz's Apartment Close-up of Simon tapping on someone's window.  It's Roz's apartment.  She's been reading on her couch, when the noise makes her jump._

speaker: Roz
text: Simon! [_gets up and opens the door_] What are you doing here?

speaker: Simon
text: [_stepping in_] Hello, love.  It appears that the front door to the building is locked.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, that's how we keep drunks from wandering in. [_pushes him out_]

speaker: Simon
text: Well, I seem to be without appropriate accommodation at the moment, I just thought I'd take you up on your kind and generous offer-

speaker: Roz
text: I never said you could stay here!

speaker: Simon
text: But Frasier's thrown me out!

speaker: Roz
text: Sleep in Martin's Winnebago.

speaker: Simon
text: Well, wouldn't I love to do that.  But when I got down there, there was this gigantic Humvee blocking the door.

speaker: Roz
text: Simon, this isn't my problem.  You have got to go. _Simon puts down his duffel and adopts a new tone, one we've never heard before - gentle and earnest._

speaker: Simon
text: Look, Roz, I'll level with you.  I know that we've had a checkered history, and I'm probably not the sort of person that you want in your house.  But I'm asking for your help. As a friend, as Daphne's brother, please just let me stay one night.  You won't even notice me.  Just the tiniest spot on the floor would be a gift.  Look, I'll be gone in the morning, I'll never darken your doorstep again.  Please, Roz, I've got nowhere else to go.

speaker: Roz
text: ...All right.  I'll make up the couch for you.

speaker: Simon
text: Oh, thank you, Roz.  You have got a good heart.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.

speaker: Simon
text: [_boorish again_] Climb on up, Susie!  We're golden! [_laughs_] She can swing on a pole for two hours, but she can't climb up a drainpipe to save her life!

speaker: Simon
text: Oi, what-? [_yells down_] Heads up, Susie! _Then she shuts the window, locking him outside.  FADE TO:  Scene Four - The Montana Mrs. Moon is smoking and playing poker with Niles._

speaker: Niles
text: Two, please. [_she deals him two_] Thank you... ha-ha!

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Well, show us what you got.

speaker: Niles
text: I've got a king, a jack, a 10, and two 6's.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Two sixes, then.

speaker: Niles
text: And-and a king.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: I'm sorry, love.  I've got aces over deuces.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that's, uh, that's the last of my mad money.  I guess I'll have to win it back some other night.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: You'd better make it soon, I won't be around much longer.

speaker: Niles
text: Not if you keep biting those filters off, you won't.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: No, I mean I'll be going back to England soon.  Well, it's nice enough here, but you and Daphne aren't the most exciting people, are you? [_Niles shakes his head_] No, as soon as I've sorted myself out, Simon and I are back on the plane.

speaker: Niles
text: Really, you are?  Uh, can I do anything to help sort?

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Thank you, no.  Oh, the shock's worn off, really.  I've come to realize I've spent most of my life taking care of a layabout husband.  Well, now it's my turn to be taken care of.  Thank God I've got Simon.

speaker: Niles
text: Simon's going to be taking care of you?

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Oh, well of course he will!  I know he plays the fool sometimes, but he'd never let me down.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you've made a lot of progress in a short amount of time, so I can't tell you how happy I am.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Oh... you good for a few more hands?

speaker: Niles
text: Why not?  Oh!  I'm out of money.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Oh, not to worry.  We can play for rubs. [_props up her feet_]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh!  I'll get my coin collection. _He leaves the room.  FADE TO:  Scene Five - Frasier's Apartment Frasier is sitting on the couch, staring at the flag and blowing a soft note on the lips of Simon's bottle.  Daphne comes out in her pajamas._

speaker: Daphne
text: Still awake, Dr. Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  It's almost dawn's early light, and our flag is still there. [_gets an idea_] Daphne!  As a subject of the British realm, does it make you feel uncomfortable to have your residence draped in the American flag?  And if so, would you be willing to say that at a condo board meeting?

speaker: Daphne
text: Personally, I find it a cozy reminder of the land I dreamed of living in as a child.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_defeated_] Off I go. _He trudges off to bed.  Daphne goes to the kitchen. Simon slips in the front door and follows her._

speaker: Daphne
text: Simon!  I thought Dr. Crane kicked you out.

speaker: Simon
text: He did, you don't see me.

speaker: Daphne
text: What are you doing here?

speaker: Simon
text: Well, I'm just getting some provisions for my trip. _He removes a six-pack, a large salami and assorted other items from the fridge._

speaker: Daphne
text: What trip?

speaker: Simon
text: Well, I just thought I'd go meet some mates in California.

speaker: Daphne
text: You can't run out on Mum, she's counting on you!

speaker: Simon
text: She's got the other boys back home.

speaker: Daphne
text: They've all sided with Dad, you know that.  You're all she's got.

speaker: Simon
text: I'm not cut out to take care of Mum, she's too demanding. She turned Dad into a shiftless drinker.  I can't have her doing that to me! [_goes to the door_]

speaker: Daphne
text: So you're just going to leave in the middle of the night and not even tell her?

speaker: Simon
text: Look, Stilts, if you want to take care of Mum, that's your choice, but I've got to live my life.

speaker: Daphne
text: You are so selfish!  For once in your life you have a chance to be responsible, be a man and do right by your family! Why don't you think about that before you go flitting off to California?

speaker: Simon
text: Well, I'm sorry, Daphne.  Maybe it makes me a bad person, but I don't have it in me.  It's not who I am.  I'll see you. _He exits, leaving her alone.  She closes the door and thinks.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Six - The Montana That same night, someone is knocking softly but urgently on the door. Niles checks the spyhole and opens it to Daphne, still in her pajamas._

speaker: Niles
text: [_whispering_] Wait, wait, quiet, quiet, quiet.  Don't wake your mother, I just got her down. [_she comes in_] What are you doing here?

speaker: Daphne
text: Something terrible has happened.  Simon's left.

speaker: Niles
text: What do you mean, left?

speaker: Daphne
text: He's gone.  He's left me to take care of Mum.  I don't know what I'm going to do, but I may have to go back to Manchester with her for a while.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, no, you can't do that.  You have a life here.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, what am I supposed to do?  I can't have her stay at Dr. Crane's, there's no room.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you can both live here.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Niles, you know she'll never go for that arrangement.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: A bit late at night for a single lady to be in a man's home, isn't it?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm here because Simon's left, off to California to do God knows what.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Oh... well, but that's courageous!  Good to see him finally taking charge of his life.

speaker: Daphne
text: He's not taking charge, he left because he doesn't want to take care of you.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: That is not so!  Simon is a special boy, he wasn't meant to be kept at home.  He has dreams.  You wouldn't understand that!

speaker: Daphne
text: Now you listen to me, Mum!  In case you haven't noticed, I've got dreams too!  I even moved halfway across the world to make a life for myself!  Do you admire that? No, you don't even acknowledge it!  Oh, and by the way, I'm no virgin!  Haven't been for years!  You remember that boy with the lazy eye you hated so much?  Yeah, he was my first!  Did it right in the parlor where you take your tea!  Then there was the German who fixed Dad's car! Oh yeah, and that Irish chap I fancied, who was twice my age and had his own van and a band!  Then I came to America, shall I go on?!

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I am a grown woman who's made her own life and her own decisions! [_takes Niles' hand_] Now, I plan to shack up with Niles here, and damned if we aren't going to do it every night of the week! _Now Niles' expression is a masterwork by David Hyde Pierce: a tight grin that shows mortified embarrassment fighting against unrestrained glee._ [__N.B. A much similar expression can be found in[[7.09]](/frasier/transcripts/season_7/episode_9/the_apparent_trap.html "The Apparent Trap") The Apparent Trap__]

speaker: Daphne
text: That's the way it's gonna be, Mum, and if you don't like it, that's just tough!

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Is that so?  Well, if that's how you repay me for all my sacrifices-

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, don't even start!

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Fine!  Just for that, I'm not spending another night under this roof.  I intend to fetch my things, find a hotel, and be on the first flight home tomorrow!  Excuse me!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh God, look at me, I'm shaking!  It just came gushing out, once I started I couldn't stop!

speaker: Niles
text: I know, it's all right, it's all right.  You were great, you were great, I have never been prouder of you.

speaker: Daphne
text: I can't believe I talked to my mother that way. [_laughs_]

speaker: Niles
text: You must have been pretty outraged to have invented all those former lovers. [_chuckles nervously_]

speaker: Daphne
text: What?

speaker: Niles
text: [_helping her along_] All those former lovers...

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, yes, right, of course!  I'm actually surprised she's leaving so easily.  I thought she'd milk it a bit more.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Just so you know - I won't be needing a lift to the hotel. I shall call a taxi.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_not turning around_] Whatever you want.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: You'll see.  I don't need any of you rotten ingrates, I can take perfectly good care of myself!

speaker: Daphne
text: Glad to hear it.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Ow!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh God, what happened?

speaker: Niles
text: Are you hurt?

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Well, of course I'm hurt! [_they help her to a chair_] Oh, get me ice-

speaker: Niles
text: All right, all right.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: And whiskey!

speaker: Niles
text: O.K.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Not cheap stuff!  Oh, I don't know how I'm gonna fly now, the pain is unbearable!  Though I know I'm not welcome here. Oh, I can't say I blame you.  No sense burdening yourself with an old woman... who can't take care of herself... and has nowhere else to go...

speaker: Niles
text: [_forcing out the words_] Oh, don't be silly.  You can stay here as long as you like.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Well, move along, the whiskey's not pouring itself. _Niles goes to the kitchen.  FADE TO:_ **NOT ONE OF THEM KNOWS THE SECOND VERSE** _Scene Seven - Building Common Room Frasier is addressing the condo board (Mr. Williams, Mrs. Richman, and another woman) and the assembled tenants._

speaker: Frasier
text: Are we fiercely patriotic?  Yes.  But how do we best demonstrate that?  Not by infringing on the rights and balconies of others, but as most good Americans do, in our hearts, with generous spirit and quiet reverence. I respectfully submit that when we display the flag as Mr. Winston has, it flies in the face of the very freedoms for which it stands.  Thank you. [_sits down_]

speaker: Williams
text: Cam, rebuttal? [  > "Patriotism,_n. Combustible rubbish ready to the torch of >     any one ambitious to illuminate his name. >       In Dr. Johnson's famous dictionary patriotism is defined >     as the last resort of a scoundrel.  With all due respect to >     an enlightened but inferior lexicographer I beg to submit >     that it is the first.  - Ambrose Bierce_]

speaker: Cam
text: The last thing I wanted was to create conflict.  I was merely trying to boost the morale of the community.

speaker: Richman
text: And so you have. [_the tenants murmur agreement_]

speaker: Williams
text: I move that the flag stays. [_agreement again_]

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, all right, ver-ver-very well, then.  B-but perhaps... perhaps we could display it on the north side of the building, for the benefit of our Canadian neighbors.

speaker: Cam
text: That was my first instinct, but it can't be illuminated at night from that side.

speaker: Richman
text: Lighting is a must.

speaker: Williams
text: Absolutely.

speaker: Richman
text: Then it's settled. [_pounds gavel_]

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, just-just hold on a second!  I feel I'm being hoodwinked.  The only reason Cam hung that flag was to get the better of me.  He knows I bought the apartment for its view!

speaker: Cam
text: No, you bought that apartment because you're free! [_agreement again_]

speaker: Albert
text: Maybe you could have a view from your balcony in _Iraq!_

speaker: Richman
text: Yes, move to Iraq!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, wait, wait, wait!  I am just as much an American as every one of you!  Perhaps Cam would just tell us how long he intends to display our beautiful flag?

speaker: Cam
text: Hmm, how about until there's world peace?

speaker: Albert
text: Oh, that's a good idea! [_agreement again_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on!  There's never going to be world peace! [_boos and hisses_]

speaker: Williams
text: Maybe there would be world peace if there were more people like Cam and fewer people like you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh now, just a second-

speaker: Cam
text: [_singing_] Oh beautiful, for spacious skies...

speaker: All but Frasier
text: For amber waves of grain, For purple mountains' majesty, Above the fruited plain... America, America... _Frasier, knowing when he's beaten, takes Cam aside as the others continue singing._

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, what do you want?

speaker: Cam
text: Your parking spot.

speaker: Frasier
text: You'll make all this stop?

speaker: Cam
text: Well, there is the matter of the flag.  I can't just take it down now.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, suggest the roof!  I'll even spring for the flagpole.

speaker: Cam
text: Everyone, everyone, everyone! [_they fall silent and sit_] The America we love is one of good neighbors.  In order to foster that, I have decided to move my flag to the roof.

speaker: Cam
text: This will not only serve to mend fences, but it will provide all of Seattle with a view of our precious Stars and Stripes.

speaker: Williams
text: You've done it again, Cam.

speaker: Richman
text: He certainly has.

speaker: Frasier
text: And, in the spirit of reciprocity, I will provide the flagpole. [_no response_] And any necessary lighting.

speaker: Albert
text: Credit grabber!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on, we're all in agreement here! [_singing_] "Oh beautiful, for spacious skies..." [_no one joins in_] Come on, everybody!  "For amber waves of grain..." _The board members shuffle their papers impatiently as Cam gives a triumphant smile._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_gives up_] Oh, all right, I'll see you next week. [_N.B. In addition to adding his voice (along with the rest of the Frasier cast) to the general encouragement of America's troops and citizens, Kelsey Grammer was a leading host of the huge joint-network television special honoring firefighters and other rescue workers fallen in New York._] _FADE TO:  Scene Eight - The Montana Niles opens the door to Daphne and Mrs. Moon._

speaker: Niles
text: How did things go at the doctor?

speaker: Daphne
text: Couldn't find anything wrong with the knee - big surprise.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: [_holds up pill bottle_] Then why did he give me sedatives, smarty?

speaker: Daphne
text: Because I begged him.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Oh, fetch me my water.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I'll get it.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_follows him_] I know how she likes it.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, but I know where the glasses are.

speaker: Daphne
text: I am so sorry about this.

speaker: Niles
text: It's all right, we'll manage.  I can live with anything - as long as I can live with you.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: [_o.s._] I'm still waiting out here!

speaker: Daphne
text: It's coming!  Pipe down!

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Why?  Am I interrupting your dirty sex?

speaker: Daphne
text: It's going to be interesting, the three of us living together.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, this is stupid.  We should just wait until she's gone.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, I said I was moving in, and I'm going to.

speaker: Niles
text: It took you your whole life to assert your independence from this woman.  I can't ask you to live under the same roof with her.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I can't ask you to live with her either.

speaker: Niles
text: [_pouring the water_] Oh well, it's just temporary.  And you know what?  She bothers you a lot more than she bothers me.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: [_o.s._] Don't empty the sink, I'm soaking my smalls!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, [_clears throat_] we've waited this long...

speaker: Daphne
text: I love you, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: I love you too. [_they kiss and hug_]

speaker: Daphne
text: And I promise, as soon as she's on a plane for England, I'm here!

speaker: Niles
text: Mrs. Moon, did the doctor mention anything about when you'd be able to fly?

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: No, didn't say a word about flying.  That's probably a bad sign, eh?

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah... _He slumps into a chair and lets his body go limp, resigned to a long wait.  END OF ACT TWO_
